reason: The article presents the Mirt stove, an energy-efficient cookstove developed by the Ministry of Water and Energy in Ethiopia. It features a cement construction with expansion chamber and pot-rest, designed for households, commercial injera bakers, and restaurants. The solution is DIY/open-source, and its unit cost is 20 USD. The article highlights the benefits of this stove, including energy efficiency and cost savings, as well as its potential to support several Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

The article presents a solar-powered irrigation system developed by Solar Development PLC, with the goal of providing affordable and clean energy for small-scale agriculture in Ethiopia. The company offers training and support for end-users, making it a viable solution for promoting sustainable development.

The article presents a solar energy solution that aims to provide clean energy to rural communities in Somalia, replacing fossil fuels and addressing energy poverty. The solution is an open-source product with a 3-year warranty, available for advance order. It has been deployed in the Somali region of Ethiopia and has reached 1000 users.

The article presents a solution for fuel-saving and less smoke stoves, focusing on establishing a networking between suppliers and end-users. It highlights the business model, costs, and technological readiness level of the solution.

The article discusses an innovative solution to combat Striga hermonthica, a parasitic weed affecting maize and other crops in sub-Saharan Africa. The project aims to improve crop yields through biological control, reduce environmental impact, and create sustainable economic opportunities for farmers. This approach aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) on poverty reduction, zero hunger, and climate action.

The article proposes a project for producing transparent face masks with a capacity of 25,000 pieces per annum. The aim is to support deaf and hearing impaired people by allowing them to read the lips of someone speaking to them. This project falls under the theme of COVID-19 and good health and well-being.

The article discusses the benefits of using a body massager machine to help individuals who spend long periods sitting or driving, reducing the risk of nervous problems, obesity, and related health issues. The project aims to provide an affordable solution for treating these conditions in Ethiopia, where access to medical treatment may be limited. The design process involved theoretical research, practical testing, and drawing. The expected outcomes include reduced diseases and improved health, as well as job creation and reduced unemployment.

The article presents a distance-limited fire accident notification technology called x-fire. It can sense fires early and notify owners and authorities via phone calls. The inventor claims it is the most efficient and affordable fire alarm, but lacks specific details on its development or market analysis. The article does not provide information on how x-fire differs from existing products in terms of features or performance.

The article presents a product that aims to reduce carbon emissions by using renewable energy and promotes sustainable growth. It highlights the benefits of using solar-powered vehicles, such as saving money on fuel costs and protecting the environment.

The article presents a mobile control home light system designed for physically disabled persons, aiming to save money on switch installation and maintenance, create a better living environment, and promote energy efficiency. The technology utilizes Bluetooth connectivity for remote control from up to 15 meters away. Although the article highlights the benefits of the product, it lacks specific details about its development process, market potential, and environmental impact assessment.
